commits.message: nvim+asdf: fix lsp & elixir config & update

nvim: add back the module attribute

It's used elsewhere.
nvim: update to cmp's new default capabilities

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: Update: I figured it out and tracked it down to a change in how ActiveRecord prepares the config URL. I'll write it up and make sure to link it here for those that are interested.

issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body:
I can't track it down exactly, but it's from a change between ActiveRecord 7.0.0.alpha2 and 7.0.0.rc1. I'll go looking over there to see if it's worth reporting, but `pg` is getting the absolute path when my repro works, so not an issue here.

For the curious:

```ruby
require 'bundler/inline'

gemfile do
  source 'https://rubygems.org'
  gem "pg", "1.4.4"
  alpha_or_rc = ENV["BUSTED"] ? "rc1" : "alpha2"
  gem "activerecord", "7.0.0.#{alpha_or_rc}"
  gem "pry", "~> 0.13.1"
end

require "active_record"
require "pry"

puts "pg version: #{PG::VERSION}"
puts "AR version: #{ActiveRecord.version()}"

host = ".direnv/postgres"
url = "postgres:///pg?host=#{host}"

pool = ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(
  adapter: "postgresql",
  url: url
)
p pool.db_config

binding.pry if ENV["DEBUG"]
conn = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.raw_connection
p conn.host
```

issue.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
issue.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby
An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `require_relative'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
Run options: include {:focus=>true}
```

The change itself is backward compatible as `puma/detect` exists in [v4.0.0](https://github.com/puma/puma/blob/v4.0.0/lib/puma/detect.rb)

pull_request.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
pull_request.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby
An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'

# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb.
```

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: I'm now wondering if there was a change in Rails/AR. Maybe it detects a relative path and yields an absolute path. I'll try to find some time to investigate that.

issue.title: Pandas-esque `describe` method
issue.body:
Are there any plans for a pandas-like `describe` method that would combine some of the aggregate methods (count, mean, standard deviation, peak) into a table to give you a rough understanding of a dataset, or is that out of scope of this library?

![1_CekpyUXF-TmP_m2YZCI7gg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699745/162600232-93823c59-871c-4c75-b791-357818e10749.png)

comment.body: I'm excited to see an open issue for this. We may be in need of profiling in the near term. I have no experience with Python or pandas, but I did just find [pandas-profiling](https://github.com/ydataai/pandas-profiling) which is maybe the 2.0 of this `describe/1` feature.

pull_request.title: Bump i18n from 0.6.1 to 0.9.5 in /bom/relational
pull_request.body:
Bumps [i18n](https://github.com/ruby-i18n/i18n) from 0.6.1 to 0.9.5.
Release notes

Sourced from i18n's releases.

v0.9.5

  • #404 reported a regression in 0.9.3, which wasn't fixed by 0.9.4. #408 fixes this issue.

Thanks @​wjordan!

v0.9.4

  • Fixed a regression with chained backends introduced in v0.9.3 (#402) - #405 - bug report / #407 - PR to fix
  • Optimize Backend::Simple#available_locales - reports are that this is now 4x faster than previously - #406

v0.9.3

(For those wondering where v0.9.2 went: I got busy after I pushed the commit for the release, so there was no gem release that day. I am not busy today, so here is v0.9.3 in its stead. This changelog contains changes from v0.9.1 -> v0.9.3)

  • I18n no longer stores translations for unavailable locales. #391.
  • Added the ability to interpolate with arrays #395.
  • Documentation for lambda has been corrected. #396
  • I18n will use oj -- a faster JSON library -- but only if it is available. #398
  • Fixed an issue with translate and default: [false] as an option. #399
  • Fixed an issue with translate with nil and empty keys. #400
  • Fix issue with disabled subtrees and pluralization for KeyValue backend #402

Thank you to @​stereobooster, @​fatkodima and @​lulalala for the patches that went towards this release. We appreciate your efforts!

v0.9.1

  • Reverted Hash#slice behaviour introduced with #250 - See #390.
  • Fixed a regression caused by #387, where translations may have returned a not-helpful error message - See #389

v0.9.0

  • Made Backend::Memoize threadsafe. See #51 and #352.
  • Added a middleware I18n::Middleware that should be used to ensure that i18n config is reset correctly between requests. See #381 and #382.

v0.8.6

Fixed a small regression introduced in v0.8.5 when using fallbacks - See #378

v0.8.5

  • Improved error message for MissingPluralizationKey error - See #371
  • Fixed a thread issue when calling translate when fallbacks were enabled - See #369

v0.8.4

Reverted #236 - "Don't allow nil to be submitted as a key to I18n.translate" - See #370

v0.8.3

I18n::Gettext#plural_keys will now return a hash from Gettext if no arguments are provided - svenfuchs/i18n#122 Fixed a bug where passing false to translate would not translate that value - svenfuchs/i18n#367

v0.8.2

Do not allow nil to be passed to translate - svenfuchs/i18n#236

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 416859a Bump to 0.9.5
  • 5c28de8 Lock Rake to 12.2.x versions
  • 29fe565 Merge pull request #408 from wjordan/enforce_available_locales_false_fix

issue.title: feat: runtime translations
issue.body:
A WIP implementation for what I've been discussing in https://github.com/elixir-gettext/gettext/issues/280

Since I don't think it makes sense to use `defoverridable` if this is meant to be part of the core, I changed from using `super` to just renaming the actual compile-time implementation functions to `lgettext_compiled` and `lngettext_compiled` and then just wrapping the call to that from `lgettext`/`lngettext` in different ways, depending on whether repo is defined or not.

comment.body: I can see this feature being of great value to us soon, so if there's anything I can do to help out, please let me know. I hope your hand is healed up by now @josevalim! ⚕️ ✋

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: Update: I figured it out and tracked it down to a change in how ActiveRecord prepares the config URL. I'll write it up and make sure to link it here for those that are interested.

comment.body:
I can't track it down exactly, but it's from a change between ActiveRecord 7.0.0.alpha2 and 7.0.0.rc1. I'll go looking over there to see if it's worth reporting, but `pg` is getting the absolute path when my repro works, so not an issue here.

For the curious:

```ruby
require 'bundler/inline'

gemfile do
  source 'https://rubygems.org'
  gem "pg", "1.4.4"
  alpha_or_rc = ENV["BUSTED"] ? "rc1" : "alpha2"
  gem "activerecord", "7.0.0.#{alpha_or_rc}"
  gem "pry", "~> 0.13.1"
end

require "active_record"
require "pry"

puts "pg version: #{PG::VERSION}"
puts "AR version: #{ActiveRecord.version()}"

host = ".direnv/postgres"
url = "postgres:///pg?host=#{host}"

pool = ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(
  adapter: "postgresql",
  url: url
)
p pool.db_config

binding.pry if ENV["DEBUG"]
conn = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.raw_connection
p conn.host
```

issue.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
issue.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby

NoMethodError:
```

pull_request.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
pull_request.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby
An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
```

The change itself is backward compatible as `puma/detect` exists in [v4.0.0](https://github.com/puma/puma/blob/v4.0.0/lib/puma/detect.rb)

comment.body: No worries. Thank you for the merge!

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: I'm now wondering if there was a change in Rails/AR. Maybe it detects a relative path and yields an absolute path. I'll try to find some time to investigate that.

issue.title: Pandas-esque `describe` method
issue.body:
Are there any plans for a pandas-like `describe` method that would combine some of the aggregate methods (count, mean, standard deviation, peak) into a table to give you a rough understanding of a dataset, or is that out of scope of this library?

![1_CekpyUXF-TmP_m2YZCI7gg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699745/162600232-93823c59-871c-4c75-b791-357818e10749.png)

comment.body: I'm excited to see an open issue for this. We may be in need of profiling in the near term. I have no experience with Python or pandas, but I did just find [pandas-profiling](https://github.com/ydataai/pandas-profiling) which is maybe the 2.0 of this `describe/1` feature.

pull_request.title: Bump i18n from 0.6.1 to 0.9.5 in /bom/relational
pull_request.body:
Bumps [i18n](https://github.com/ruby-i18n/i18n) from 0.6.1 to 0.9.5.
Release notes

Sourced from i18n's releases.

v0.9.5

  • #404 reported a regression in 0.9.3, which wasn't fixed by 0.9.4. #408 fixes this issue.

Thanks @​wjordan!

v0.9.4

  • Fixed a regression with chained backends introduced in v0.9.3 (#402) - #405 - bug report / #407 - PR to fix
  • Optimize Backend::Simple#available_locales - reports are that this is now 4x faster than previously - #406

v0.9.3

(For those wondering where v0.9.2 went: I got busy after I pushed the commit for the release, so there was no gem release that day. I am not busy today, so here is v0.9.3 in its stead. This changelog contains changes from v0.9.1 -> v0.9.3)

  • I18n no longer stores translations for unavailable locales. #391.
  • Added the ability to interpolate with arrays #395.
  • Documentation for lambda has been corrected. #396
  • I18n will use oj -- a faster JSON library -- but only if it is available. #398
  • Fixed an issue with translate and default: [false] as an option. #399
  • Fixed an issue with translate with nil and empty keys. #400
  • Fix issue with disabled subtrees and pluralization for KeyValue backend #402

Thank you to @​stereobooster, @​fatkodima and @​lulalala for the patches that went towards this release. We appreciate your efforts!

v0.9.1

  • Reverted Hash#slice behaviour introduced with #250 - See #390.
  • Fixed a regression caused by #387, where translations may have returned a not-helpful error message - See #389

v0.9.0

  • Made Backend::Memoize threadsafe. See #51 and #352.
  • Added a middleware I18n::Middleware that should be used to ensure that i18n config is reset correctly between requests. See #381 and #382.

v0.8.6

Fixed a small regression introduced in v0.8.5 when using fallbacks - See #378

v0.8.5

  • Improved error message for MissingPluralizationKey error - See #371
  • Fixed a thread issue when calling translate when fallbacks were enabled - See #369

v0.8.4

Reverted #236 - "Don't allow nil to be submitted as a key to I18n.translate" - See #370

v0.8.3

I18n::Gettext#plural_keys will now return a hash from Gettext if no arguments are provided - svenfuchs/i18n#122 Fixed a bug where passing false to translate would not translate that value - svenfuchs/i18n#367

v0.8.2

Do not allow nil to be passed to translate - svenfuchs/i18n#236

... (truncated)

issue.title: feat: runtime translations
issue.body:
A WIP implementation for what I've been discussing in https://github.com/elixir-gettext/gettext/issues/280

Since I don't think it makes sense to use `defoverridable` if this is meant to be part of the core, I changed from using `super` to just renaming the actual compile-time implementation functions to `lgettext_compiled` and `lngettext_compiled` and then just wrapping the call to that from `lgettext`/`lngettext` in different ways, depending on whether repo is defined or not.

comment.body: I can see this feature being of great value to us soon, so if there's anything I can do to help out, please let me know. I hope your hand is healed up by now @josevalim! ⚕️ ✋

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: Update: I figured it out and tracked it down to a change in how ActiveRecord prepares the config URL. I'll write it up and make sure to link it here for those that are interested.

issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body:
I can't track it down exactly, but it's from a change between ActiveRecord 7.0.0.alpha2 and 7.0.0.rc1. I'll go looking over there to see if it's worth reporting, but `pg` is getting the absolute path when my repro works, so not an issue here.

For the curious:

```ruby
require 'bundler/inline'

gemfile do
  source 'https://rubygems.org'
  gem "pg", "1.4.4"
  alpha_or_rc = ENV["BUSTED"] ? "rc1" : "alpha2"
  gem "activerecord", "7.0.0.#{alpha_or_rc}"
  gem "pry", "~> 0.13.1"
end

require "active_record"
require "pry"

puts "pg version: #{PG::VERSION}"
puts "AR version: #{ActiveRecord.version()}"

host = ".direnv/postgres"
url = "postgres:///pg?host=#{host}"

pool = ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(
  adapter: "postgresql",
  url: url
)
p pool.db_config

binding.pry if ENV["DEBUG"]
conn = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.raw_connection
p conn.host
```

issue.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
issue.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 


issue.title: Add ExAws.S3 example with Mix.install config
issue.body: Really I wanted to highlight the `:config` and `:system_env` ability from `Mix.install/2`. My actual use case was from a livebook where I needed to use [ConfigParser](https://hexdocs.pm/configparser_ex/) because of SSO.

comment.body: No worries. Thank you for the merge!

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: I'm now wondering if there was a change in Rails/AR. Maybe it detects a relative path and yields an absolute path. I'll try to find some time to investigate that.

issue.title: Pandas-esque `describe` method
issue.body:
Are there any plans for a pandas-like `describe` method that would combine some of the aggregate methods (count, mean, standard deviation, peak) into a table to give you a rough understanding of a dataset, or is that out of scope of this library?

![1_CekpyUXF-TmP_m2YZCI7gg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699745/162600232-93823c59-871c-4c75-b791-357818e10749.png)

comment.body: I'm excited to see an open issue for this. We may be in need of profiling in the near term. I have no experience with Python or pandas, but I did just find [pandas-profiling](https://github.com/ydataai/pandas-profiling) which is maybe the 2.0 of this `describe/1` feature.

pull_request.title: Bump i18n from 0.6.1 to 0.9.5 in /bom/relational
pull_request.body:
Bumps [i18n](https://github.com/ruby-i18n/i18n) from 0.6.1 to 0.9.5.
Release notes

Sourced from i18n's releases.

v0.9.5

  • #404 reported a regression in 0.9.3, which wasn't fixed by 0.9.4. #408 fixes this issue.

Thanks @​wjordan!

v0.9.4

  • Fixed a regression with chained backends introduced in v0.9.3 (#402) - #405 - bug report / #407 - PR to fix
  • Optimize Backend::Simple#available_locales - reports are that this is now 4x faster than previously - #406

v0.9.3

(For those wondering where v0.9.2 went: I got busy after I pushed the commit for the release, so there was no gem release that day. I am not busy today, so here is v0.9.3 in its stead. This changelog contains changes from v0.9.1 -> v0.9.3)

  • I18n no longer stores translations for unavailable locales. #391.
  • Added the ability to interpolate with arrays #395.
  • Documentation for lambda has been corrected. #396
  • I18n will use oj -- a faster JSON library -- but only if it is available. #398
  • Fixed an issue with translate and default: [false] as an option. #399
  • Fixed an issue with translate with nil and empty keys. #400
  • Fix issue with disabled subtrees and pluralization for KeyValue backend #402

Thank you to @​stereobooster, @​fatkodima and @​lulalala for the patches that went towards this release. We appreciate your efforts!

v0.9.1

  • Reverted Hash#slice behaviour introduced with #250 - See #390.
  • Fixed a regression caused by #387, where translations may have returned a not-helpful error message - See #389

v0.9.0

  • Made Backend::Memoize threadsafe. See #51 and #352.
  • Added a middleware I18n::Middleware that should be used to ensure that i18n config is reset correctly between requests. See #381 and #382.

v0.8.6

Fixed a small regression introduced in v0.8.5 when using fallbacks - See #378

v0.8.5

  • Improved error message for MissingPluralizationKey error - See #371
  • Fixed a thread issue when calling translate when fallbacks were enabled - See #369

v0.8.4

Reverted #236 - "Don't allow nil to be submitted as a key to I18n.translate" - See #370

v0.8.3

I18n::Gettext#plural_keys will now return a hash from Gettext if no arguments are provided - svenfuchs/i18n#122 Fixed a bug where passing false to translate would not translate that value - svenfuchs/i18n#367

v0.8.2

Do not allow nil to be passed to translate - svenfuchs/i18n#236

... (truncated)

issue.title: feat: runtime translations
issue.body:
A WIP implementation for what I've been discussing in https://github.com/elixir-gettext/gettext/issues/280

Since I don't think it makes sense to use `defoverridable` if this is meant to be part of the core, I changed from using `super` to just renaming the actual compile-time implementation functions to `lgettext_compiled` and `lngettext_compiled` and then just wrapping the call to that from `lgettext`/`lngettext` in different ways, depending on whether repo is defined or not.

comment.body: I can see this feature being of great value to us soon, so if there's anything I can do to help out, please let me know. I hope your hand is healed up by now @josevalim! ⚕️ ✋
